intro: Calyptrion hybanthus, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
